territory.notes: The Dominican Republic celebrates February 27, 1844, the date that it essentially overthrew Haitian rule, as its independence day. From 1861 until 1865, it was a Spanish colony. During the first quarter of the 20th century, the United States increasingly exerted control over the Dominican Republic, establishing first a customs receivership in 1905, followed by a military government in 1916 that endured until 1924. From 1965 to 1966, the United States, along with the Organization of American States, again militarily intervened in the Dominican Republic.
